result.execSummary:
The defendant Dolph E. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

DNA Sample if not already done.
AODA and follow through.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dolph E. Peterson

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:59 PM/Rm. 301/State by DA Elizabeth Gebert.  Def. appears, in custody, with Atty. John Zich.  Court reporter by Zoom.  Plea agreement. 
 State makes record regarding Def. waiving right to attorney and now having Atty. Zich representing him.  On plea to both counts (information mirrors complaint and copy emailed to Def.'s Atty.)  Ct. 1 - impose & stay 54 mos. prison, 30 mos. initial confinement and 24 mos. extended supervision, 3 years probation, costs, DNA sample if not already done & surcharge, AODA & follow through, absolute sobriety,  no illegal possession  of controlled substances, no presence in establishments with a Class B liquor license, $545.07 restitution, maintain employment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent..  Ct. 2 - impose & stay 1 year jail consecutive, 3 years  probation  concurrent to Ct. 1, costs, DNA and same conditions as Ct. 1.  Victim rights complied with.  Court  advises Def. of right to preliminary hearing and reviews form filed with the Court with Def.  Def. waives preliminary hearing, Court accepts  waiver, finds probable cause and binds case over.  Def.'s Atty. has copy of information and he waives its reading.  Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form filed.  Court reviews with Def.  Ct. 1 - no contest plea.  Ct. 2 - no contest plea.  Court advises  Def. of constitutional rights and right to jury trial.  Def. waives rights and jury trial.  Court advises Def. of elements and penalties.  Def. advised of possible deportation if not US citizen.  Court finds pleas entered freely and voluntarily.  Factual basis.  Court accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Cts. 1 and 2.  Sentencing remarks by State. Sentencing remarks by Def.'s Atty.  Def. has nothing to say.  Court orders Ct. 1 - 4 1/2 years prison, 2 1/2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision, imposed and stayed, 3 years probation, costs, DNA sample if not already done and surcharge, AODA and follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal possession of controlled substances, no presence is establishments with Class B liquor license, restitution $545.07, maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Ct. 2 - 1 year jail imposed and stayed, huber, consecutive to Ct. 1, 3 years probation, costs, same conditions as Ct. 1.  Credit 21 days if revoked.  Def. is eligible for the Earned Release and Challenge Incarceration Programs.  Def. advised of voting and firearm rights. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.
Defendant's retraction letter of waiver of right to attorney

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 10:59 AM in Room 301. Defendant Dolph E. Peterson in court, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Dolph E. Peterson appeared by video means. All appearances are by Zoom. State gives clarification as to reason for today's hearing. Def. wants to represent self. Court in recess at 11:03 a.m. On the record at 11:05 a.m. Court reviews waiver of right to attorney. Court finds Def. has waived attny, finds competent and will allow to represent self. Court advises Def. as to right to a preliminary hearing. Def. waives time limits for P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits for P.H. Court will schedule for anticipated plea/sentencing. Def. requests discussion as to bond. State didn't have notice. No changes as to bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on June 22, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
regarding bond / Routed to CC's JA
Adjourned initial appearance on June 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
No contact with any Wal-Mart Stores.

02:12 PM Defendant Dolph E. Peterson in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dolph E. Peterson appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.      Def. does not have copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Copy of complaint will be provided to def.   Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to contact P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation & request $2,000 cash bond with condition   No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, & No contact with Wal-Mart. State has faxed copy of complaint to jail. Def. has copy of complaint.   Def. heard on bond.  Court orders $2,000 cash bond with conditions.  Court adjourns.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
